metadata.name: Basic Psychological Need Satisfaction and Frustration Scale
metadata.authors: Chen, B., Vansteenkiste, M., Beyers, W., Boone, L., Deci, E. L., Van der Kaap-Deeder, J., ... & Verstuyf, J.
metadata.citation: Chen, B., et al. (2015). Basic psychological need satisfaction, need frustration, and need strength across four cultures. Motivation and Emotion, 39(2), 216-236.
metadata.license: Published instrument, available from SDT Center (selfdeterminationtheory.org)
metadata.stem: Please read each of the following items carefully, thinking about how it relates to your life, and then indicate how true it is for you.

items.text: I feel a sense of choice and freedom in the things I undertake.
I feel that my decisions reflect what I really want.
I feel my choices express who I really am.
I feel forced to do many things I wouldn't choose to do.
I feel pressured to do too many things.
My daily activities feel like a chain of obligations.
I feel confident that I can do things well.
I feel capable at what I do.
I feel competent to achieve my goals.
I have serious doubts about whether I can do things well.
I feel disappointed with many of my performance.
I feel insecure about my abilities.
I feel that the people I care about also care about me.
I feel connected with people who care for me, and for whom I care.
I feel close and connected with other people who are important to me.
I feel excluded from the group I want to belong to.
I feel that people who are important to me are cold and distant towards me.
I have the impression that people I spend time with dislike me.
I feel that my choices are based on my true interests and values.
I feel under pressure to do what others tell me.
I feel I can successfully complete difficult tasks.
I feel like a failure because of the mistakes I make.
I experience a warm feeling with the people I spend time with.
I feel the relationships I have are just superficial.

validation.sample_description: Cross-cultural validation across Belgium, China, USA, Peru (Chen et al., 2015)
